column4: Can I ask a question about Nautilus? or should I go somewhere else?
ask
For some odd reason, whenever I try to open any folders (Ie. anything on my desktop, home folder, etc.) Nautilus closes unexpectedly. Upon trying to report the bug, bug-buddy closes unexpectedly. : (
run "nautilus" in the terminal and see what happens
is there any output?
None at all
well that is kind of hard to troubleshoot
Yeah, I know!
you can install thunar or something for the time being if you need a graphical file manager
yeah, you can use the terminal
move files with mv, copy files with cp, remove files with rm and so forth and so on
thunar is very small
I wouldn't uninstall nautilus
Less than 10meg?
3meg
it has dependencies
the actualy thunar download is just 384 kb
It has whats?
dependencies, packages that it needs to run, it is probably installing those
Um. I might be dumber than I look. I'm downloading the 'graphical installer' because I figured there was less chance of me fouling up with a GUI around things. Obviously that was a bad idea.
yeah delete that stuff
ubuntu has its own software repositories accessed through apt-get, so just do "sudo apt-get install thunar"
I keep forgetting that I can do that.
top
